qas.question: As what was the event mistaken by some pagans?
Why was a solar eclipse impossible?
Which Greek historian wrote about these natural occurrences?
Who reigned Rome during the Crucifixion of Jesus?
What other event supposedly took place that shook people?
In what year was the first known solar eclipse?
During what event was Phlegon born?
What Jewish feast day was first celebrated in the 2nd century AD?
What did Origen believe he witnessed when he wrote about it in the 2nd century AD?
During who's rule did Origen write about an eclipse?

context: Some Christian writers considered the possibility that pagan commentators may have mentioned this event, mistaking it for <a0_0><b6_0>a solar eclipse<b6_0/><a0_0/> - although this would have been impossible during the <b7_0>Passover<b7_0/>, which takes place at <a1_0>the full moon<a1_0/>. Christian traveller and historian Sextus Julius Africanus and Christian theologian Origen refer to <a2_0>Greek historian Phlegon<a2_0/>, who lived in the <b5_0>2nd century AD<b5_0/>, as having written "with regard to the <b8_0>eclipse<b8_0/> in the time of <a3_0><b9_0>Tiberius Caesar<b9_0/><a3_0/>, in whose reign Jesus appears to have been crucified, and the great <a4_0>earthquakes<a4_0/> which then took place"
